Participants.evidence: Patients undergoing isolated CABG from July 2020 to December 2022 in Nanjing First Hospital

Objective.evidence: The aim of this research was to evaluate the prognosis and mid-term outcomes in CABG patients with mild renal dysfunction.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were acute kidney injury (AKI) and all-cause mortality in follow-up

Number_Randomised.evidence: Totally 1,097 patients were enrolled in this study and 416 (33.3%) had mild renal dysfunction.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 379 pairs were included to the analysis after propensity score matching.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 3-year follow-up, there were also no significant differences in all-cause mortality (6.3% vs. 4.8%, log-rank p = 0.33, HR 1.38, 95%CI: 0.721–2.652) and MACCE rates (10.2% vs. 7.6%, log-rank p = 0.19, HR 1.42, 95%CI: 0.836–2.414).

Harms.evidence: patients with mild renal dysfunction had more AKI after CABG (26.1% vs. 18.7%, p = 0.015)
